intro: Schizoglossum bidens, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sunflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other sunflowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with a distinct central disk. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open areas. Schizoglossum bidens is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
